metadata.titel_preek: Moses and Monotheism: A Response to Dr. Freud

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts human history and religious projections to reveal His self-existent nature and initiate the liberation of His people.

tekstueel_bewijs: The subject of the story is not Moses at all. It is God.
God called unto Moses out of the midst of the bush
I have come down to deliver them

object.identificatie: The revelation of God's true nature and the liberation of the oppressed.
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s presence with Moses and the people in the event of the redemption from bondage
to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians

zender.identificatie: The Self-Existent God (I AM WHO I AM)
tekstueel_bewijs: I am not what you think... I AM the Creator of all that is.
Christ died for the ungodly — for the irreligious and impious
I have seen the affliction of my people
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver/Object of God's action, not the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Burning Bush / Christ (as the climax of the movement)
tekstueel_bewijs: The burning bush is an ineffable symbol
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses the Bush/Christ as the means of encounter.

tekstueel_bewijs: The last illusion, Freud believed, is religion.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Religion is viewed as a fundamental self-deception that masks the reality of the living God; it is an ontological barrier.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the human subject to God's call (Ethics/Mission).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Moses / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Participation in God's work of liberation.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response (participation) is strictly a result of being 'commandeered' or 'impressed' by the primary Subject (God).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Burning Bush → God ← Human Illusion/Religion

voorbeelden_god_subject: God allows himself... to be pushed out of the world
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I identify myself with some words

voorbeelden: I will turn aside and see
Moses at this point does not know who he is
I have come down to deliver them
While we were still helpless, Christ died

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) over against human 'helplessness'. It is a theology of divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Religion) to ~S1 (Freud's Atheism) as a necessary clearing, then to S1 (Revelation) which is 'Religionless'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by being 'over against' all human categories, including religion.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the preacher uses Freud to destroy 'cheap' religion to make room for 'costly' revelation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects anthropocentric religion in favor of a theocentric event where God is the sole initiator and actor.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The subject of the story is not Moses at all. It is God.
While we were still helpless, Christ died for the ungodly.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses is explicitly described as 'not a super-spiritual person' and 'commandeered', preventing him from being a moral hero.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Moses (as a recipient of grace, not a model of virtue)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Moses is the site of God's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'religion' and 'wishes'; awe at divine transcendence.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is tightly integrated around the 'God as Subject' theme, linking Exodus to the Cross seamlessly.
spanning_punten: The tension between Freud's valid critique of religion and the Bible's claim to be 'non-religion'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s mighty work of liberation... deliverance from bondage.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'fire' that sets the hearer ablaze suggests an endowment of power (Pouvoir).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as being 'sentenced to death' and 'helpless'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the 'exemplarist' trap by deconstructing Moses' character.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a proper grace-orientation.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Illusion) is already cosmic in scale.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Grammar of Grace' by refusing to let the human actor take the lead.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Freud/Woolf as 'hooks'; Greimas shows they function as 'Opponents' to the 'Object' of true faith.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew name YHWH; Greimas shows how the name functions as a 'Sender' of values that contradicts human 'Wishes'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Revolution' mentioned at the end is actually a change in the Actantial Subject of the hearer's life.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'via negativa' approach, using Freud to strip away false subjects before revealing the true Subject.
